UNDP Jobs - 78339 - Individual Consultant - Project Coordinator Creating Employment and Entrepreneurship Opportunities for Women in India (Disha) is a multi - year partnership project between United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) and India Development Foundation (IDF)
column2: supported by IKEA Foundation. Project Disha aims to reach out and enable one million underprivileged women in India through training
column4: as well as development of a new model of public private collaboration that can be adapted and replicated across India. The project activities are implemented across four states of India viz. NCR Delhi & Haryana
column6: Karnataka and Telangana. The project works in close partnership with GOI Ministries and departments
column7: public and private organizations especially skilling institutes
column8: employers and livelihood organizations to facilitate job placement and entrepreneurship activities among young women.

column1: Since the start of the Proof of the Concept phase in October 2015
column2: more than 100 pilots have been designed and more than twenty pilots completed and fifty pilots are in various stages of completion. The lessons from these pilots
column3: evaluated during the mid - term review and the strategic review in
column4: led to the creation of four concrete models that cuts across the three verticals (bridging the information gap
column5: skills to job and entrepreneurship) . They are briefly summarized below:

column1: Model 1: Creation of career guidance and counselling framework in government schools and colleges to enable girls from the under - privileged sections make and pursue informed and inspired career choices.

Model 2: Creation of employment bazaar or marketplace in unserved smaller towns and semi - urban areas which according to a recent McKinsey report have scope for large traction in terms of employment and / or apprenticeship sourcing.

Model 3: Micro - enterprise in rural areas and self - employment in urban areas responding to the preference of women with domestic responsibilities for local sources of livelihood as well as the opportunities arising of changing lifestyle
Model 4: Enterprise opportunities through value chain linkages with the organized sector in areas such as agri - produce
column3: and artisanal products. These areas are the mainstay of livelihood for women in the non - formal sector. Over the past two years the project has evolved substantially and it now requires focusing on delivering in accordance with the models developed. There is a clear mandate on institutionalizing these models into the government and / or the corporate sector while leveraging resources to ensure sustainability.

To manage Budget to determine how much the company has spent and what it can purchase in the near future. Being an operations manager is all about serving customers; therefore the individual needs to know how much money is in a company s budget to provide the products and services that will retain customers. PayCraft firmly believes that National Common Mobility Card (NCMC) or the One Nation One Card (ONOC) is the answer to the global problem of disintegrated transit ticketing. Based on EMV standards and with the flexibility of stored value cards
column2: PayCraft s common mobility solutions brings the best of all worlds in one plastic. The solution works on an underlying principle that the consumer should be able to pay without cash and using his Bank s card even if there is no network connectivity at the point of sale terminal.

column1: PayCraft firmly believes that National Common Mobility Card (NCMC) or the One Nation One Card (ONOC) is the answer to the global problem of disintegrated transit ticketing. Based on EMV standards and with the flexibility of stored value cards
column2: PayCraft s common mobility solutions brings the best of all worlds in one plastic. The solution works on an underlying principle that the consumer should be able to pay without cash and using his Bank s card even if there is no network connectivity at the point of sale terminal.

column1: National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) owns and operates Rupay card scheme which offers its contactless payment technology based on EMV called the National Common Mobility Card (NCMC). NCMC is an inter - operable transport card conceived by the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs of the Government of India. PayCraft is a pioneer and a leading solution provider for the NCMC technology in India. The solution enables banks to issue NCMC debit or prepaid cards which can be used in transit as a contactless payment method and in retail or online platforms just like any other banking card.
PCI DSS and PA DSS certified

Banks can now upgrade their regular debit card management system to NCMC capable debit card management system. Government of India s vision for One Nation One Card (ONOC) envisages that every debit card in India shall have capability to handle contactless transit transaction. This would mean that debit cards shall be issued with contactless chip supporting Rupay qSparc specifications. PayCraft offers the NCMC DCMS plugin which helps banks to start issuing qSparc enabled debit cards and manage transit transaction without making much change to the existing debit card management system of a bank.
